definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: It asks me less and gives more.
sentences.chinese: 它给予的永远比讨取的多。

sentences.english: Fill up your resume with seminars and training you took up with your previous employer.
sentences.chinese: 把你的简历丰富并向以前的雇主讨取经验。

sentences.english: The more she has to work for your affections, the more she'll be into you。
sentences.chinese: 她为讨取你的欢心做得越多，她就会爱你越深。

sentences.english: Said differently, guys try to get women to like them by doing whatever the woman wants.
sentences.chinese: 换个说法就是，男人让女人为所欲为来讨取她的欢心。

definition: to ask for sth back/to recover
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to try to gain sb's friendship
to press (fruit)/variant of 敲詐|敲诈[qiao1 zha4]
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to ask for sth and receive it/to try to obtain/to look for and obtain
to show off one's accomplishments (often derog.)
